stimulusHtml: What type of study was being conducted by the researcher?

features.html: Researchers measured changes in neural firing in the frontal lobes for ten rats that were exposed to stimulants. The researchers used an MRI that indicates brain activity with colors. Normal brain activity is indicated by greens and yellows. High brain activity is indicated by reds and oranges. Low brain activity is indicated by grays and blues. All the ratâ€™s brains showed normal activity prior to being exposed to the stimulant.
